emuInput.TitMainTitle: Barbara Jefferson, Joyce Johnson, and Pearl Johnson Mitchell seated in wooded chairs at coroner's inquest about the murder of Julia Mae Johnson Mitchell
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1953, pg. 3, reads: "Their Tragedy, A Challenge - Pictured at a coroner's inquest, held last Thursday, into the rape - strangulation of 10-year-old Julia Mae Johnson of 3 Sachem Way on July 10, were, left to right: Barbara Jefferson, who was perhaps the last person to see the 10-year-old girl alive, and Joyce, 15-year-old sister, and her mother, Mrs. Pearl Johnson Mitchell. The tragedy was termed 'unfortunate' by Coroner William D. McClelland, who emphasized that police 'expend every effort to apprehend the fiend.'"
